Columns.Comment: Primary key. Type of action of the drug e.g., agonist, antagonist
Description of how the action type is used

Columns.Nullable: Higher-level grouping of action types e.g., positive vs negative action

Columns.Comment: Unique ID for the activity row
Foreign key to the assays table (containing the assay description)

Columns.Nullable: Foreign key to documents table (for quick lookup of publication details - can also link to documents through compound_records or assays table)

Columns.Comment: Foreign key to the compound_records table (containing information on the compound tested)

Columns.Nullable: Foreign key to compounds table (for quick lookup of compound structure - can also link to compounds through compound_records table)
Same as PUBLISHED_VALUE but transformed to common units: e.g. mM concentrations converted to nM.
Selected 'Standard' units for data type: e.g. concentrations are in nM.
Shows whether the standardised columns have been curated/set (1) or just default to the published data (0).
Standardised version of the published_activity_type (e.g. IC50 rather than Ic-50/Ic50/ic50/ic-50)
Previously used to report non-numeric activities i.e. 'Slighty active', 'Not determined'. STANDARD_TEXT_VALUE will be used for this in future, and this will be just for additional comments.

Comment reflecting whether the values for this activity measurement are likely to be correct - one of 'Manually validated' (checked original paper and value is correct), 'Potential author error' (value looks incorrect but is as reported in the original paper), 'Outside typical range' (value seems too high/low to be correct e.g., negative IC50 value), 'Non standard unit type' (units look incorrect for this activity type).

Columns.DataType: When set to 1, indicates that the value is likely to be a repeat citation of a value reported in a previous ChEMBL paper, rather than a new, independent measurement. Note: value of zero does not guarantee that the measurement is novel/independent though

Columns.Nullable: Negative log of selected concentration-response activity values (IC50/EC50/XC50/AC50/Ki/Kd/Potency)
ID for the corresponding result type in BioAssay Ontology (based on standard_type)
ID for the corresponding unit in Unit Ontology (based on standard_units)
ID for the corresponding unit in QUDT Ontology (based on standard_units)
The Test Occasion Identifier, used to group together related activity measurements
Where the activity is a range, this represents the highest value of the range (numerically), while the PUBLISHED_VALUE column represents the lower value
Where the activity is a range, this represents the standardised version of the highest value of the range (with the lower value represented by STANDARD_VALUE)
Foreign key to source table, indicating the source of the activity value

Columns.Comment: Type of end-point measurement: e.g. IC50, LD50, %inhibition etc, as it appears in the original dataset

Columns.Nullable: Symbol constraining the activity value (e.g. >, <, =), as it appears in the original dataset
Datapoint value as it appears in the original dataset.
Units of measurement as they appear in the original dataset

Columns.DataType: Standardized version of additional information about the measurement

Columns.Nullable: Foreign key to action_type table; specifies the effect of the compound on its target.

Columns.Comment: Unique ID for each record.
FK to ACTIVITY_ID in ACTIVITIES table.
The parameter or property type

Columns.Nullable: Numberical value for the parameter or property
Non-numerical value of the parameter or property

Columns.Comment: A flag to indicate, if set to 1, that this type is a dependent variable/result (e.g., slope) rather than an independent variable/parameter (0, the default).
FK to SMID in ACTIVITY_SUPP_MAP, and a FK to SMID in ACTIVITY_SUPP
Primary key.
The standard_type that other published_types in the activities table have been converted to.

The units that are applied to this standard_type and to which other published_units are converted. Note a standard_type may have more than one allowable standard_unit and therefore multiple rows in this table.

Columns.Nullable: The lowest value for this activity type that is likely to be genuine. This is only an approximation, so lower genuine values may exist, but it may be desirable to validate these before using them. For a given standard_type/units, values in the activities table below this threshold are flagged with a data_validity_comment of 'Outside typical range'.

The highest value for this activity type that is likely to be genuine. This is only an approximation, so higher genuine values may exist, but it may be desirable to validate these before using them. For a given standard_type/units, values in the activities table above this threshold are flagged with a data_validity_comment of 'Outside typical range'.

Columns.Comment: Unique ID for each record.

Datapoint value as it appears in the original dataset.
Units of measurement as they appear in the original dataset
Non-numeric value for measurement as in original dataset

screening, confirmatory (ie: dose-response), summary, panel, other,Thermal shift assay QC liability, Thermal shift assay, Affinity biochemical assay, Incucyte cell viability, Affinity phenotypic cellular assay, HTRF assay, Selectivity assay, Cell health data, NanoBRET assay, Alphascreen assay, Affinity on-target cellular assay, ITC assay, GPCR beta-arrestin recruitment assay

Name of the organism for the assay system (e.g., the organism, tissue or cell line in which an assay was performed). May differ from the target organism (e.g., for a human protein expressed in non-human cells, or pathogen-infected human cells).
NCBI tax ID for the assay organism.
Name of specific strain of the assay organism used (where known)
Name of tissue used in the assay system (e.g., for tissue-based assays) or from which the assay system was derived (e.g., for cell/subcellular fraction-based assays).

Target identifier to which this assay has been mapped. Foreign key to target_dictionary. From ChEMBL_15 onwards, an assay will have only a single target assigned.
Flag indicating of the relationship between the reported target in the source document and the assigned target from TARGET_DICTIONARY. Foreign key to RELATIONSHIP_TYPE table.

Confidence score, indicating how accurately the assigned target(s) represents the actually assay target. Foreign key to CONFIDENCE_SCORE table. 0 means uncurated/unassigned, 1 = low confidence to 9 = high confidence.
Indicates the level of curation of the target assignment. Foreign key to curation_lookup table.

Columns.Comment: Primary key
ATC code (foreign key to atc_classification table)
Drug to which the ATC code applies (foreign key to molecule_dictionary table)
Internal Primary Key for the molecule
ChEMBL identifier for this compound (for use on web interface etc)

Columns.Nullable: Maximum phase of development reached for the compound across all indications (4 = Approved, 3 = Phase 3 Clinical Trials, 2 = Phase 2 Clinical Trials, 1 = Phase 1 Clinical Trials, 0.5 = Early Phase 1 Clinical Trials, -1 = Clinical Phase unknown for drug or clinical candidate drug ie where ChEMBL cannot assign a clinical phase, NULL = preclinical compounds with bioactivity data)

Columns.Comment: Indicates that a drug has a therapeutic application, as opposed to e.g., an imaging agent, additive etc (1 = yes, 0 = default value).
Indicates that the drug is dosed in this form, e.g., a particular salt (1 = yes, 0 = default value)

Indicates whether the molecule has a small molecule structure or a protein sequence (MOL indicates an entry in the compound_structures table, SEQ indications an entry in the protein_therapeutics table, NONE indicates an entry in neither table, e.g., structure unknown)

Columns.Nullable: Preferred ChEBI ID for the compound (where different from assigned). TO BE DEPRECATED - please use UniChem (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/unichem/).
Type of molecule (Small molecule, Protein, Antibody, Antibody drug conjugate, Oligosaccharide, Oligonucleotide, Cell, Enzyme, Gene, Unknown)
Earliest known approval year for the drug (NULL is the default value)

Columns.Comment: Indicates whether the drug is known to be administered orally (1 = yes, 0 = default value)
Indicates whether the drug is known to be administered parenterally (1 = yes, 0 = default value)
Indicates whether the drug is known to be administered topically (1 = yes, 0 = default value).
Indicates that the drug has a black box warning (1 = yes, 0 = default value)
Indicates whether the compound is a natural product as defined by COCONUT (https://coconut.naturalproducts.net/), the COlleCtion of Open Natural ProdUcTs. (1 = yes, 0 = default value)

Indicates whether this is known to be the first approved drug of its class (e.g., acting on a particular target). This is regardless of the indication, or the route of administration (1 = yes, 0 = no, -1 = preclinical compound ie not a drug).
Shows whether a drug is dosed as a racemic mixture (0), single stereoisomer (1), an achiral molecule (2), or has unknown chirality (-1)

Indicates that the drug is a pro-drug. See active_molregno field in molecule hierarchy for the pharmacologically active molecule, where known (1 = yes, 0 = no, -1 = preclinical compound ie not a drug)
Indicates whether the molecule is inorganic i.e., containing only metal atoms and <2 carbon atoms (1 = yes, 0 = no, -1 = preclinical compound ie not a drug)

Columns.Nullable: The year in which the application for a USAN/INN name was granted. (NULL is the default value)
The availability type for the drug (-2 = withdrawn, -1 = unknown, 0 = discontinued, 1 = prescription only, 2 = over the counter)
Where the drug or clinical candidate name can be matched, this indicates the USAN stem (NULL is the default value). Also described in the USAN_STEMS table.
Indicates whether a molecule is a small molecule polymer, e.g., polistyrex (1 = yes, 0 = default value)
Where the drug or clinical candidate name can be matched, this indicates the USAN substem (NULL is the default value)
Definition of the USAN stem (NULL is the default value)
Indication class(es) assigned to a drug in the USP dictionary. TO BE DEPRECATED - please use DRUG_INDICATION table.

Columns.Comment: Indicates an approved drug has been withdrawn for toxicity reasons for all indications, for all populations at all doses in at least one country (not necessarily in the US). (1 = yes, 0 = default value)
Indicates whether the compound is a chemical probe; for exact definition see release notes (1 = yes, 0 = default value).
Indicates orphan designation, i.e. intended for use against a rare condition (1 = yes, 0 = no, -1 = preclinical compound ie not a drug)
Primary key.
Foreign key to frac_classification table showing the mechanism of action classification of the compound.
Foreign key to molecule_dictionary, showing the compound to which the classification applies.

Foreign key to compounds table. This field holds a list of all of the ChEMBL compounds with associated data (e.g., activity information, approved drugs). Parent compounds that are generated only by removing salts, and which do not themselves have any associated data will not appear here.

Columns.Nullable: Represents parent compound of molregno in first field (i.e., generated by removing salts). Where molregno and parent_molregno are same, the initial ChEMBL compound did not contain a salt component, or else could not be further processed for various reasons (e.g., inorganic mixture). Compounds which are only generated by removing salts will appear in this field only. Those which, themselves, have any associated data (e.g., activity data) or are launched drugs will also appear in the molregno field.

Where a compound is a pro-drug, this represents the active metabolite of the 'dosed' compound given by parent_molregno. Where parent_molregno and active_molregno are the same, the compound is not currently known to be a pro-drug.

Columns.Comment: New Drug Applications (NDA or innovator)
Primary key.
Foreign key to the PROTEIN_CLASSIFICATION table. The protein_class to which this synonym applies.

Columns.Nullable: The synonym for the protein class.
The type or origin of the synonym (e.g., ChEMBL, Concept Wiki, UMLS).

Columns.Comment: Primary key. Unique identifier for each protein family classification.

Columns.Nullable: Protein_class_id for the parent of this protein family.
Preferred/full name for this protein family.
Short/abbreviated name for this protein family (not necessarily unique).

Columns.Comment: Concatenated description of each classification for searching purposes etc.
Level of the class within the hierarchy (level 1 = top level classification)
Relationship_type flag used in the assays table
Primary key.

Columns.Nullable: Foreign key to research_stem table. TO BE DEPRECATED.
Name of current company associated with this research code stem. TO BE DEPRECATED.
Country in which the company uses this research code stem. TO BE DEPRECATED.
Previous name of the company associated with this research code stem (e.g., if the company has undergone acquisitions/mergers). TO BE DEPRECATED.

Columns.Comment: Primary key. Unique ID for each research code stem. TO BE DEPRECATED.

Columns.Nullable: The actual stem/prefix used in the research code. TO BE DEPRECATED.

Columns.Comment: Primary key.
Foreign key to binding_sites table.

Columns.Nullable: Foreign key to the component_sequences table, indicating which molecular component of the target is involved in the binding site.
Foreign key to the domains table, indicating which domain of the given molecular component is involved in the binding site (where not known, the domain_id may be null).
List of residues from the given molecular component that make up the binding site (where not know, will be null).

Columns.Comment: Identifier for each source (used in compound_records and assays tables)

Columns.Nullable: A short name for each data source, for display purposes

Columns.Comment: Unique ID for the structural alert set
Name (or origin) of the structural alert set
Priority assigned to the structural alert set for display on the ChEMBL interface (priorities >=4 are shown by default).
Primary key. Unique identifier for the structural alert
Foreign key to structural_alert_sets table indicating which set this particular alert comes from
A name for the structural alert
SMARTS defining the structural feature that is considered to be an alert
Foreign key to the target_dictionary, indicating the target to which the components belong.
Foreign key to the component_sequences table, indicating which components belong to the target.
Primary key.

Indicates that the given component is a homologue of the correct component (e.g., from a different species) when set to 1. This may be the case if the sequence for the correct protein/nucleic acid cannot be found in sequence databases. A value of 2 indicates that the sequence given is a representative of a species group, e.g., an E. coli protein to represent the target of a broad-spectrum antibiotic.
Unique ID for the target

Columns.Nullable: Describes whether target is a protein, an organism, a tissue etc. Foreign key to TARGET_TYPE table.

Columns.Comment: Preferred target name: manually curated

Columns.Nullable: Source organism of molecuar target or tissue, or the target organism if compound activity is reported in an organism rather than a protein or tissue

Columns.Comment: ChEMBL identifier for this target (for use on web interface etc)

Flag to indicate whether the target represents a group of species, rather than an individual species (e.g., 'Bacterial DHFR'). Where set to 1, indicates that any associated target components will be a representative, rather than a comprehensive set.
Identifier for target of interest (foreign key to target_dictionary table)
Relationship between two targets (e.g., SUBSET OF, SUPERSET OF, OVERLAPS WITH)
Identifier for the target that is related to the target of interest (foreign key to target_dicitionary table)
Primary key
Target type (as used in target dictionary)

Columns.Nullable: Higher level classification of target_type, allowing grouping of e.g., all 'PROTEIN' targets, all 'NON-MOLECULAR' targets etc.

Columns.Comment: Primary key, numeric ID for each tissue.

Columns.Nullable: Uberon ontology identifier for this tissue.

Columns.Comment: Name for the tissue (in most cases Uberon name).

Columns.Nullable: Experimental Factor Ontology identifier for the tissue.

Columns.Comment: ChEMBL identifier for this tissue (for use on web interface etc)

Columns.Nullable: BRENDA Tissue Ontology identifier for the tissue.
Swiss Institute for Bioinformatics CALOHA Ontology identifier for the tissue.

Columns.Comment: Numeric primary key.
Stem defined for use in United States Adopted Names.

Columns.Nullable: More specific subgroup of the stem defined for use in United States Adopted Names.
Meaning of the stem (e.g., the class of compound it applies to).
Indicates whether stem is used as a prefix/infix/suffix/combined prefix and suffix
Protein family targeted by compounds of this class (e.g., GPCR/Ion channel/Protease) where known/applicable. TO BE DEPRECATED.

Columns.Comment: Primary key, numeric ID for each sequence variant; -1 for unclassified variants.

Columns.Nullable: Details of variant(s) used, with residue positions adjusted to match provided sequence.
UniProt accesion for the representative sequence used as the base sequence (without variation).
Version of the UniProt sequence used as the base sequence.
Details of the UniProt isoform used as the base sequence where relevant.
Variant sequence formed by adjusting the UniProt base sequence with the specified mutations/variations.
Organism from which the sequence was obtained.
NCBI Tax ID for the organism from which the sequence was obtained

Columns.Comment: Name of release version
Primary key for the warning reference

Columns.Nullable: Foreign key to the drug_warning table
Identifier for the reference in the source
Full URL linking to the reference
